trans-unit.source: Represents a date in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay> object represents a date in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.

You can use this class in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.DayRender> event handler to programmatically access the properties of a date as it is rendered on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.

This allows you to determine the properties of the day (such as whether the date is selectable, selected, today's date, or a weekend date) and programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay> class.
Although this constructor is available, an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay> class is not typically created dynamically.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay>.
Property
Initial Value
Date
The value of the `date` parameter.
DayNumberText
The value of the `dayNumberText` parameter.
IsOtherMonth
The value of the `isOtherMonth` parameter.
IsSelected
The value of the `isSelected` parameter.
IsToday
The value of the `isToday` parameter.
IsWeekend
The value of the `isWeekEnd` parameter.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object that contains the date represented by an instance of this class.
`true` to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is either a Saturday or a Sunday; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is the current date; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is selected on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, `false`.

`true` to indicate that the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the displayed month on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, `false`.
The day number for the date represented by this class.
Gets the date represented by an instance of this class.
This property is read-only.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.Date%2A> property to programmatically determine the date represented by an instance of this class.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object that contains the date represented by an instance of this class.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
Gets the string equivalent of the day number for the date represented by an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay"></xref> class.
This property is read-only.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.DayNumberText%2A> property to determine the string equivalent of the day number for the date represented by an instance of this class.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
The string equivalent of the day number for the date represented by an instance of this class.

Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the month displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This property is read-only.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.IsOtherMonth%2A> property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the month displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day based on this value.
`true` if the date represented by an instance of this class is in a month other than the month displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class can be selected in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.IsSelectable%2A> property to specify or determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class can be selected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance behavior of the day, based on this value.
`true` if the date can be selected; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is selected in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This property is read-only.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.IsSelected%2A> property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is selected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
`true` if the date represented by an instance of this class is selected in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is the same date specified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control.
This property is read-only.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.IsToday%2A> property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is the same date specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
Although the date specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate%2A> property is usually the system date on the server, it is possible to change it, if necessary.

`true` if the date represented by an instance of this class is the same date specified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.TodaysDate"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar"></xref> control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the date represented by an instance of this class is a either Saturday or Sunday.
This property is read-only.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.IsWeekend%2A> property to programmatically determine whether the date represented by an instance of this class is either a Saturday or a Sunday.
This allows you to programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day, based on this value.
`true` if the date represented by an instance of this class is either a Saturday or a Sunday; otherwise, `false`.
